About Us | Brazilian Beat Home About Us Events Services Gallery Press FAQ Contact Home About Us Events Services Gallery Press FAQ Contact About Us Home > About Us About Suzanne Thorson Suzanne Thorson, founder & Creative Director of Brazilian Beat‚Ñ¢ in the USA, a company dedicated to showcasing the exquisite beauty of one of the most famous and dazzling events in the world: the Carnaval of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The group was founded in 1991 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and traveled throughout the world delighting audiences with stunning performances and extravagant pageantry. The second version of Brazilian Beat is based in Boca Raton, Florida. Suzanne is a former ballerina and actress. Brazilian Beat Around the World ‚ÄúCarnaval‚Äù is the largest and most popular Brazilian Festival, a true live opera that takes place on an Avenue in Rio de Janeiro named ‚ÄúPassarela do Samba‚Äù (Runway of Samba). On this Avenue built specially for this unique event, the ‚ÄòSchools of Samba‚Äô parade and compete to be crowned the best of each year. Brazilian Beat is a performing arts group specialized in traditional Brazilian music & dance. We also offer Belly dance with fire, Argentinian tango, salsa, etc. Read More '; zoom view Focus Brasil Awards 2018 & 2019 Events '; zoom view Performances with Brazilian Voices Events '; zoom view Brazilian Beat at Samba Carousel Events Suzanne Thorson, founder & Creative Director of Brazilian Beat‚Ñ¢ in USA, a company dedicated to showcase the exquisite beauty of one of the most famous and dazzling events in the world: the Carnaval of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Brazilian Beat 2018 | Downtown Boca Raton Events HOME Login / Register contact us 561.998.9015 ENGLISH ‰∏≠Êñá FRAN√áAIS ÌïúÍµ≠Ïñ¥ ITALIANO Êó•Êú¨Ë™û DEUTSCH PORTUGU√äS –†–£–°–°–ö–ò–ô ESPA√ëOL TI·∫æNG VI·ªÜT Champagne & Parisi Search Homes Condos Townhomes Agents Resources Contact Boca Raton Real Estate Search Home Blog Boca Raton News & Events Back to Blog Posts Prev Next Brazilian Beat 2018 | Downtown Boca Raton Posted by Stephanie Kukich on Wednesday, September 5, 2018 at 1:38 PM By Stephanie Kukich / September 5, 2018 Comment Share On Saturday, September 8th, Brazilian Beat 2018 will be held at Mizner Park Amphitheater in Downtown Boca Raton, FL. Now in its 7th year, the Brazilian Beat festival brings the art, music, and dance of Brazilian culture to our local community for the official annual celebration of Brazilian Independence. Headlining Brazilian Beat 2018 will be Dogo Nogueira, one of the biggest stars in Brazilian music today. A multifaceted artist and seven-time Latin Grammy award winner, Nogueira will be singing samba, the rhythmic, upbeat music that is synonymous with Brazilian culture. The event will also feature a Rio-style Samba Parade by SambaLa Samba School, a Zumba showcase, a Capoeira circle, samba drummers, and street dancing, as well as authentic Brazilian cuisine and cocktails. The Brazilian Beat festivities will take place from 6:00 pm to 11:00 pm at Mizner Park Amphitheater, located at 590 Plaza Real, Boca Raton, FL 33432. Admission to the event is free and all ages are welcome. With incredible live entertainment, fantastic food, live music, and dancing, Brazilian Beat 2018 is an exciting, high-energy event that you surely do not want to miss. Come¬†out and join the thousands of others from across South Florida to celebrate Brazilian Independence and experience a taste of Rio right here in Boca Raton. We at Champagne & Parisi Real Estate look forward to seeing you there! For more information about Brazilian Beat, 2018 at Mizner Park Amphitheater call 561-393-7807 or visit the¬†Downtown Boca Raton Event Page. Cutting-edge Events Plan Your Event The Fiery Beat of the Brazilian Culture. The Best Event Entertainment Ideas for weddings, fundraisers, corporate functions, hora loca and much more. opening performances Let's Chat Looking for an opening performance for your show or event? LET‚ÄôS CHAT ABOUT YOUR NEXT EVENT Contact Us Now Performing Arts We‚Äôve got the beat! Interactive Corporate Event Entertainment Interactive Corporate Event Entertainment Suzanne Thorson is the founder & Creative Director of Brazilian Beat‚Ñ¢ USA. The Best ideas for weddings, fundraisers, corporate functions, hora loca and much more! Services services Belly Dance with fire services Corporate Events services Fashion Shows services Festivals services Fundraisers services Hora Loca Weddings services Private Functions services Public Speaker Interactive Live Entertainment Corporate Events, fundraisers, private functions, shows, sports events and much more‚Ä¶ Newsfeed Stay Up to Date Learn more about the latest event trends. Discover new opportunities while learning more about Brazilian Culture, Arts and Entertainment. Creative Corporate Event Ideas Creative Corporate Event Ideas Don‚Äôt you think it‚Äôs time for you to kiss those boring party‚Äôs goodbye? Your guests deserve to have fun at your next corporate event, and that‚Äôs why we‚Äôre here to give you some creative corporate event ideas. Planning a corporate event...... 19 February, 2021 No comment Interactive Entertainment Ideas Interactive Entertainment Ideas Entertaining a large crowd at your event isn‚Äôt exactly easy, but it‚Äôs not impossible either. There are many ways you can engage a large number of attendees, without breaking your back. Offering interactive entertainment to your guests is a great way to...... 19 February, 2021 No comment Elevate Your Corporate Events with Creativity In the realm of corporate events, creativity and interactivity can make all the difference. Gone are the days of dull conferences. Today, companies are striving to engage their employees and clients in unique and memorable ways. One surefire approach to achieving this is through incorporating...... 02 May, 2024 No comment Carnaval 2024 in Rio de Janeiro Carnaval is a world-renowned festival, portraying the celebrated rhythm of Brazil. Tourists from all over the world go to Rio de Janeiro, aiming to experience something unique, a bucket list dream, a spectacle unlike any other. In Rio de Janeiro, the samba schools parade, leaving...... 26 March, 2024 No comment FAQ Frequently Asked Questions Where does Brazilian Beat perform? BB is a performing arts group that is hired for events and special occasions. We do not perform at a regular location. Is BB family friendly? Individuals of all ages love the exposure to the Brazilian culture. We have performed for lower school graduation ceremonies and other school activities, including St. Andrew‚Äôs school and American Heritage. For what type of events does BB perform? We customize our performances to meet expectations for a wide array of occasions. This includes corporate events, trade shows, fundraisers, weddings, graduation ceremonies, birthday parties, Holiday celebrations, business openings, fashion shows, product launches, etc. Are BB performances limited to Traditional Brazilian culture? Choreographed dance and traditional Brazilian music is our specialty. Additionally, we offer juggling tambourines, Capoeira (Brazilian dance of war), Argentinian tango, salsa, belly dance with fire. What differentiates BB from other Latin dance companies? Brazilian Beat‚Äôs wardrobe is out of the ordinary. Our performers showcase costumes weighing in excess of 60 pounds, extending up to 9 feet high. Where does BB source it‚Äôs costumes? Our costumes are made in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. They are handmade and can take up to six months to complete. Can you provide examples of some creative ideas for children‚Äôs parties? For a 12 year old‚Äôs birthday party, we provided a samba workshop and encouraged the kids to join the performance. What about Hora Loca? We were voted as ‚ÄúThe Best Hora Loca in South Florida‚Äù two years running. Can you provide an example of a creative idea for a wedding? For a bride planning a surprise for the groom, we incorporated her into the show. The guests were thrilled and the groom was mystified. Are the extravagant costumes only used with samba? Not necessarily. At Miami Art Basel, a greeter in extravagant costume, welcomed the guests to techno music. Guests stood in line to get pictures. How can we promote our company‚Äôs brand with Brazilian Beat? Our extravagant costumes are a great attention grabber, we recommend that you display your company‚Äôs logo at the photo set to boost your social media. What They Say This was one of my most favorite moments of the entire wedding! I felt so much joy the entire time I was dancing and had a BLAST! Brazilian Beat is amazing and I feel so grateful to be able to have performed with them. Suzanne's professionalism , kindness , attention to detail, and sheer passion for her art is inspiring. The dancers were so talented, beautiful, fun , and encouraging ... I loved dancing along side them. The drummers were so skilled and created the best beats . I was dancing in the kitchen the entire time I was in hiding because their beats were that good! Overall Brazilian Beat brought the heat, and many great vibes to our wedding and for that I am forever thankful! Alexandra A. Wow!  I saw this dance entertainment company at the Little Brazil restaurant,  Boca Raton. 100% recommend the show!!  It was FUN; beautiful to watch the dancers, drummers and also dance with them.  We learned about the culture and took pictures with them.  If you're visiting or even living here, this is a MUST to experience üôÇ Claudia H. What a stunning addition to any event! The extravagant costumes and performances are definetely the highlight of any occasion.
Suzanne Thorson has a sharp vision for art, marketing and entertainment and a great sense for adapting the performance for any event, from royalty, which she has done worldwide, to any sized corporation's event or trade shows. Caroline Z. I started working with Suzanne at the beginning of the year for my December 2019 wedding. We met initially at her studio where she explained every detail, showed me costumes, answered all my questions, etc. She also met with me at my wedding venue months in advance so that she would know exactly where she and her entertainer's park, arrive, their entrance as well as the main reception/performance area. So professional! Marsha G. - https://www.yelp.com/biz/brazilian-beat-boca-raton?osq=brazilian+beat Amazing experience!!!! 100%% recommend! From
beginning to end! Suzanne the owner is involved in every detail, so take her advise because she knows what she's doing! Everyone at the wedding couldn't stop talking about it or dancing it was like we were in Rio Carnaval! I am Brazilian so I can tell you it's 100% legit! Would hire 1000 times more! Thank you all the dancers and musicians and Suzanne for a espectacular performance! By the way the performers looked in great shape and not old and chubby like a lot of them do! . Catherina S. - https://www.yelp.com/biz/brazilian-beat-boca-raton?osq=brazilian+beat Great Company. We hired them for several events. The team always on point. Suzanne the owner always willing to help and do the extra mile.
And not forgetting to say. The ROI is great. The exposure and the energy that brings to the attendees is phenomenal.
We did from small events to big conferences. All successfully accomplished. They still talking about us and the Samba Dancers after years.
Definitely recommended! Calendar Mundi Suzanne Thorson, founder & Creative Director of Brazilian Beat‚Ñ¢ in USA, a company dedicated to showcase the exquisite beauty of one of the most famous and dazzling events in the world: the Carnaval of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. These Brazilian nuns go viral after dropping the beat on Catholic TV | PBS News Full Episode Wednesday, Sep 10 Close Menu PBS NewsHour Episodes Podcasts Newsletters The Latest Politics Brooks and Capehart Politics Monday Supreme Court Arts CANVAS Poetry Now Read This Nation Supreme Court Race Matters Essays Brief But Spectacular World Agents for Change Economy Making Sen$e Paul Solman Science The Leading Edge ScienceScope Basic Research Innovation and Invention Health Long-Term Care Education Teachers' Lounge Student Reporting Labs For Teachers Newshour Classroom About Feedback Funders Support Jobs Close Menu You asked for news you can trust. We deliver with clarity and context. Donate now Close Popup I've already supported PBS News Menu Notifications Get news alerts from PBS News Turn on desktop notifications? Yes Not now Full Episodes Podcasts Newsletters Live By ‚Äî Tatiana Pollastri, Associated Press Tatiana Pollastri, Associated Press Leave your feedback Share Copy URL https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/these-brazilian-nuns-go-viral-after-dropping-the-beat-on-catholic-tv Email Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Pinterest Tumblr Share on Facebook Share on Twitter These Brazilian nuns go viral after dropping the beat on Catholic TV World May 28, 2025 12:32 PM EDT SAO PAULO (AP) ‚Äî Two Brazilian nuns have gone viral after dropping an impromptu beatbox and dance session during a Catholic television program. READ MORE: Pope Leo XIV completes formalities to become bishop of Rome, declaring ‚ÄòI am Roman!‚Äô Sisters Marizele Cassiano and Marisa de Paula, members of the ‚ÄúCopiosa Reden√ß√£o‚Äù congregation, were talking about a vocational retreat on Brazil‚Äôs Pai Eterno ‚Äî Eternal Father ‚Äî TV channel when they brought up a song about being called to the religious life. The duo stood up and launched into a routine complete with singing, beatbox and dance moves. Then the presenter, Deacon Giovani Bastos, joined in, matching Sister de Paula‚Äôs moves in a performance that‚Äôs now been seen by millions on social media in Brazil and abroad. ‚ÄúBeatboxing, dancing, and the songs itself, are tools that God uses to reach the hearts of the people we work with. And it works! It‚Äôs beautiful to see,‚Äù said Sister Marizele Cassiano. ‚ÄúThat moment was very spontaneous, because with Sister Marisa, if you start a beat, she will dance. And I‚Äôm used to singing, to beatboxing, so for us it was very simple, spontaneous and at the same time very surprising to see that it went viral even outside Brazil,‚Äù Sister Marizele Cassiano, beatboxing nun, told The Associated Press.The Sisters are dedicated to young people who are struggling with drug addiction. They say music has been a powerful tool to help those in need. ‚ÄúBeatboxing, dancing, and the songs itself, are tools that God uses to reach the hearts of the people we work with. And it works! It‚Äôs beautiful to see,‚Äù said Sister Marizele Cassiano. While Sister Marisa has no Instagram account, Sister Marizele has surpassed 100,000 followers since her beatboxing went viral. The sisters also work as vocation promoters, organizing retreats for women interested in pursuing a religious career. We're not going anywhere. Stand up for truly independent, trusted news that you can count on! Donate now Left: Nuns beatboxing and dancing during a show on a Catholic TV network.
